text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cream cheesy cube zucchini
with lemon and oregano so this is a very
very nice spring vegetable side dish
that you're going to love you know as
much as anyone could actually love a
vegetable side dish all right so the
prep here is very simple I have three
medium zucchini I cut them in half I cut
them lengthwise and then simply cube
them in two I'd say those are
quarter-inch cubes the size does not
matter as I'm always telling you it's
the consistency that matters so if yours
are a little smaller or a little bigger
that's fine but try to give me as
uniform as possible and that is simply
so they cook evenly I'm gonna heat a
couple tablespoons of olive oil on high
heat and a heavy skillet until it just
starts to shimmer it's not quite smoking
but it's got to be hot I'm gonna add my
zucchini now because they're small
because they're cubed they're gonna cook
pretty quick so you kind of have to be
careful with this that we get all the
flavoring in before it's done so as it's
searing here I'm going to throw in some
red pepper flakes you know for a little
heat a little fun i'ma throw in some
lemon zest okay now there's no lemon
juice in this okay I'm going to serve
this with a little fresh lemon at the
end but I don't want the acid cooking
into it at this point I just want a
little bit of lemon flavor zest perfect
for that and I'm also not going to put
any salt and pepper quite yet salt draws
out water I want to give these a little
sear I want the outside to caramelize a
little bit before I season with salt and
pepper okay
so I cooked that for maybe another
minute and a half then I'm going to give
it a little salt and pepper all right I
can't confirm or deny that I snuck in a
little Cayenne at that point all right
another few seconds and I decided this
zucchini is almost tender not quite but
almost at that point I added a couple
tablespoons of crumbled up cream cheese
and I thought it would do the same thing
as cream but also would have a little
bit of Tanous and a little bit of
cheesiness because it's cream cheese so
I threw that in soon as that kind of
starts to blend into the zucchini turn
off the heat and when it's all mixed in
and looks like that we're pretty much
done to finish I hit some fresh
Ashley chopped oregano from the backyard
that I blend it in there and that I have
to say came out really nice okay so you
see there have a little bit of fresh
lemon to cut through some of that
perceived richness by the way I said
perceive richness because this really
isn't that rich but it seems rich okay
which is sort of the nice thing about
the recipe so basically we have a simple
sauteed zucchini just spiked a little
bit with cream cheese hot pepper oregano
and lemon what a great combination I
hope you give this a try you could serve
this simply as a vegetable side dish but
as I'm looking at that right there I'm
thinking wow how awesome would some
grilled shrimp be on top of that and
then I answered my own question pretty
awesome so you can use this as a base or
like I said just a simple side dish I
hope you give it a try
all the ingredients are on the site as
usual and as always enjoy
